header: Order below exh.4 in Cri. MA No. 37/2019 CNR No. MHPU01­000072—2019

background.text: 1. Perused the application and documentary evidence placed on record. Heard the learned Counsel for the applicant. 2. By this application, under Section 438 of Cr.P.C., the applicant / accused – Supriya Tanaji Rawlekar seeks interim protection in Crime No. 1433/2018, registered with Hadpsar Police Station, Pune, under Sections 420, 465, 467, 468, 471 r.w.s. 34 of Indian Penal Code.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under sections 420, 465, 467, 468, 471 r.w.s. 34 of indian penal code

arguments.text: 3. The learned Counsel for the applicant has submitted that the applicant has no role to play in alleged offences. Already, accused 1, her husband is released on bail.

argumentSentences.text: The learned Counsel for the applicant has submitted that the applicant has no role to play in alleged offences.
Already, accused 1, her husband is released on bail.

arguments.text: 4. On going through copy of FIR, it is evident that duo accused had agreed to purchase a flat and paid some­ sum, applied for home­loan. Thus, the transaction seems to be of civil nature. 5. In view of above, apprehension in the mind of applicant seems to be reasonable, warranting ad­interim­ protection, until hearing of exh.1. Hence, the order :

argumentSentences.text: On going through copy of FIR, it is evident that duo accused had agreed to purchase a flat and paid some­ sum, applied for home­loan.
Thus, the transaction seems to be of civil nature.
In view of above, apprehension in the mind of applicant seems to be reasonable, warranting ad­interim­ protection, until hearing of exh.1.

order.text: ORDER 1) The application stands allowed as under :­ In the event of arrest, the applicant be released on furnishing P.R and S.B of Rs.15,000/­, on following conditions:­ a) She shall not tamper prosecution witnesses. b) She shall not leave India sans the permission of this Court. 2) Issue show cause notice to respondents as to why said order should not be confirmed.

processedText:
Order below exh.4 in Cri. MA No. 37/2019 CNR No. MHPU01­000072—2019 
---header-ends---
1. Perused the application and documentary evidence placed on record. Heard the learned Counsel for the applicant. 2. By this application, under Section 438 of Cr.P.C., the applicant / accused – Supriya Tanaji Rawlekar seeks interim protection in Crime No. 1433/2018, registered with Hadpsar Police Station, Pune, under Sections 420, 465, 467, 468, 471 r.w.s. 34 of Indian Penal Code. 
---background-ends---
3. The learned Counsel for the applicant has submitted that the applicant has no role to play in alleged offences. Already, accused 1, her husband is released on bail. 
---argument-ends---
4. On going through copy of FIR, it is evident that duo accused had agreed to purchase a flat and paid some­ sum, applied for home­loan. Thus, the transaction seems to be of civil nature. 5. In view of above, apprehension in the mind of applicant seems to be reasonable, warranting ad­interim­ protection, until hearing of exh.1. Hence, the order : 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1) The application stands allowed as under :­ In the event of arrest, the applicant be released on furnishing P.R and S.B of Rs.15,000/­, on following conditions:­ a) She shall not tamper prosecution witnesses. b) She shall not leave India sans the permission of this Court. 2) Issue show cause notice to respondents as to why said order should not be confirmed. 
---order-ends---
Notice r/o: 17.01.2019. Pune. (Vikas S. Kulkarni) January 02, 2019 Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. -3­ I affirm that the contents of this P.D.F.,file judgment are same word for word as per original Judgment. Name of Steno :­ Smt.
